div.div: melting with thirst associated with stomach heat

bibl.title: Ben cao gang mu dictionary Vol1

entry.def: melting with thirst associated with stomach heat

sense.def: Pathological Condition of xiao ke 消渴 , melting with thirst, brought forth by heat in the stomach. The basic pathological mechanism of ‘melting with thirst’ comprises a yin depletion with dryness and heat in the triple burner. Hence a ‘melting with thirst’ associated mainly with stomach heat is a zhong xiao 中消 , central melting. Zheng lei ben cao 證類本草 Substance Entry su mi 粟米：陳者味苦，主胃熱消渴，利小便 , “Old ones have a bitter flavor. They control melting with thirst associated with stomach heat , and they free the passage of urine”.
